Event.name: Process_resume
Event.definition:
<def-root>An event resumes at a certain <fen>Place</fen> and <fen>Time</fen>. NB: Refer to Event frame.
<ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Process">Both matches</fex> will <t>resume</t> <fex name="Time">tomorrow</fex>, <fex name="Time">after a day of rest</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Process">Negotiations between Israel and the Palestinian authority</fex> have <t>resumed</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of <fen>Time</fen> for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Process
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Process</fen> which is being resumed.<ex><fex name="Process">The meeting</fex> <t>resumed</t> after the bomb threat passed.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that the Process resumes.
<ex>The tenth emergency special session <t>resumed</t> <fex name="Frequency">twice more</fex> to address ongoing violations against the security council resolution </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>Trading resumed <fex name="Manner">in an orderly fashion</fex> on Monday</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: resume.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: begin again or continue after a pause or interruption. NB: The action is not usually resumed at the beginning with this verb, but rather at the point in the Ongoing process where it was interrupted.

lexUnit.name: restart.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to resume to take place
